comments.body: This needs to always add an extra chunk for the file, or we could end up with collisions of the form `a/b/c` colliding with `a/b/c/d`. Appending `/state` or something would fix this (it needs to be something non-hex so it can't collide itself).
Turns out this isn't an issue because variable-length strings seem to be encoded with a length prefix, which makes prefix collisions impossible.

diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@

+object StateKeys {
+  private val NameChunkSize: Int = 32
+
+  def resolveStateKey(root: Path, key: DamlStateKey): Path = {
